title: ESPN predicts the winner of Clemson basketball vs NC State
description: Who will win Tuesday's matchup between the 18th-ranked Clemson Tigers and Will Wade's NC State Wolfpack? Here's ESPN's prediction.
fullText:
The Clemson Tigers host the NC State Wolfpack in midweek play Tuesday to start the fourth week of ACC basketball play.

Clemson (16-3 overall) finds itself unbeaten and 6-0 in conference play after taking down a streaking Miami Hurricanes team that had won 10 straight games before Saturday. In the Tigers' 69-59 win over the 'Canes, Clemson jumped out to an 8-0 lead in the opening minutes and never trailed.

Carter Welling had a career-high 18 points, Jestin Porter added 11, and RJ Godfrey had 10 points as Clemson won its ninth straight overall since its last-second loss to BYU at the Jimmy V Classic at Madison Square Garden on Dec. 9. The Tigers also ended a 10-game Miami winning streak.

NC State (12-6, 3-2) carries no such streak into Tuesday's game. The Wolfpack are coming off a 78-74 upset loss to Georgia Tech on Saturday in Raleigh despite 16 points from Quadir Copeland. Senior forward Darrion Williams leads NC State in scoring this season with 14.2 points per game.

TV announcers, start time for Clemson basketball vs NC State Wolfpack https://t.co/Ufn6beaHyR pic.twitter.com/D56TubDJAz

‚Äî Clemson Wire (@Clemson_Wire) January 19, 2026

ESPN's¬†matchup predictor, which offers a prediction model based on its college basketball power index (BPI) and other variables, gives Clemson a 67.5% chance to win and NC State a 32.5% chance.

The Tigers are 23rd nationally in ESPN's latest BPI ratings, up one spot from last week. Clemson has a 15.9 overall rating. The metrics give the Tigers an 6.4 rating on offense that ranks 49th nationally, and a 9.4 rating on defense that's 16th nationally.

NC State is 28th nationally in BPI. The Wolfpack have an 8.3 rating on offense that ranks also 28th nationally and a 6.5 rating on defense that's 38th.

Rounded up, ESPN's¬†BPI ratings give Clemson an overall final record projection of 24-7, the same as last week. That includes a 14-4 mark in ACC play. The Tigers' remaining strength of schedule rates 74th nationally.

Clemson is currently given a 14.6% chance of winning the ACC title, which is down slightly from 15% before the Tigers' win over Miami.

The Duke Blue Devils lead ESPN's BPI with a 24.3 rating (12.3 offense, 12.0 defense). Among ACC teams, Clemson is ranked fourth in BPI, one spot behind Virginia.

Here's a full look at all 18 teams ranked by ESPN's basketball power index.

18. Boston College Eagles (0.2 BPI)

17. Georgia Tech Yellow Jackets (3.4 BPI)

16. Florida State Seminoles (4.7 BPI)

15. Stanford Cardinal (6.8 BPI)

14. Pittsburgh Panthers (7.0 BPI)

13. California Golden Bears (7.4 BPI)

12. Virginia Tech Hokies (8.2 BPI)

11. Notre Dame Fighting Irish (8.4 BPI)

9. Wake Forest Demon Deacons (10.3 BPI)

6. North Carolina Tar Heels (13.4 BPI)

5. NC State Wolfpack (14.8 BPI)

3. Virginia Cavaliers (16.5 BPI)

2. Louisville Cardinals (20.4 BPI)

Where is Clemson basketball ranked? New AP Top 25 poll revealed https://t.co/JaoPIkriNI pic.twitter.com/EscYeCgYiF

‚Äî Clemson Wire (@Clemson_Wire) January 19, 2026

The College Basketball Power Index (BPI) is a measure of team strength that is meant to be the best predictor of performance going forward. BPI represents how many points above or below average a team is. Strength of Record (SOR) is a measure of team accomplishment based on how difficult a team's W-L record is to achieve. Game predictions account for opponent strength, pace of play, site, travel distance, day's rest and altitude, and are used to simulate the season 10,000 times to produce season projections. Numbers update daily."

title: Patrick Mahomes discusses strong trust in the Chiefs‚Äô training staff
description: Patrick Mahomes discusses strong trust in the Kansas City Chiefs‚Äô training staff | @EdEastonJr
fullText:
Kansas City Chiefs quarterback Patrick Mahomes continues to rehab after surgery on his knee. He spoke with reporters recently, discussing the importance of his relationship with Assistant Athletic Trainer Julie Frymyer when dealing with the injury.

‚ÄúI think it‚Äôs extremely important because what I‚Äôve found out throughout this process is not every day is going to feel amazing,‚Äù said Mahomes, ‚ÄúThere‚Äôs some days you‚Äôre going to be sore or some days you‚Äôre going to feel stiff, but you have to have someone you trust that‚Äôs going to get the best out of you, that‚Äôs going to keep you safeand someone that‚Äôs going to push you more than anything. Some days I want to go in there and crush rehab (and) some days I just want to get through it, but she (Assistant Athletic Trainer Julie Frymyer) doesn‚Äôt let you have the get through it days.‚Äù

Mahomes has shown trust in Frymyer off the field, as she co-starred with him in a recent State Farm commercial alongside singer Meghan Trainor.

‚ÄúShe pushes you to be the best every single day. It‚Äôs been a different process, kind of jumping right into working out like this,‚Äù said Mahomes, ‚ÄúI always worked out, built up throughout the offseason, but it‚Äôs been fun to be with people that care about me, and that want to push me to be the best that I can be. I‚Äôm in that training room every single day, and I‚Äôm trying to make sure that I‚Äôm ready to go as quickly as possible.‚Äù

Kansas City‚Äôs medical staff will be hard at work this offseason to get the franchise quarterback up and running ahead of the 2025 season.

This article originally appeared on Chiefs Wire: Patrick Mahomes discusses strong trust in the Chiefs‚Äô training staff

title: Fulham lead Troy Parrott race as three clubs target Republic of Ireland hero
description: The AZ Alkmaar striker has impressed in the Eredivisie and hit five goals against Portugal and Hungary to guide the Republic of Ireland into a World Cup 2026 play-off
fullText:
Fulham are battling Wolfsburg and Real Betis in the race to sign Troy Parrott following his huge impact in the Republic of Ireland‚Äôs quest to qualify for the World Cup 2026.

So far, the trio are the clubs that have gone in strongest in what is expected to be a wide race for the AZ Alkmaar forward over the next few months.

The 23-year-old's profile exploded after the five goals against Portugal and Hungary that sent Heimir Hallgrimsson‚Äôs side into a World Cup play-off.

But that was only on the back of burgeoning development that had made a series of clubs around the Premier League and European football take note of his impact in the Netherlands.

Wolfsburg have talked about a ‚Ç¨20m (¬£17.4m) deal, but it is understood that AZ would want even more. Fulham have so far shown the strongest interest from the Premier League.

Having energised his career at AZ, though, Parrott is understood to want to be very considerate about his next steps. While the forward does want to return to the Premier League at some point - he initially came through the Tottenham Hotspur system - any English move would have to fully make sense for both his current position and future prospects, which is why he is happy to stay in Europe.

The Bundesliga is an appealing option, particularly with the way the competition has proven so successful in developing young talent.

Away from his prolific run for his country, Parrott has hit nine goals in 13 Eredivisie games, with 10 more goals this term in Conference League qualifiers and the KNVB Cup.

Parrott is tied fourth in the Eredivisie top scorer standings, with Ayase Ueda clear with 18 goals in as many games for Feyenoord.

With the final game of the season now played, we can officially turn the page to the 2026 regular season, as the Irish will look to return to the CFP after being left out. title: Records fall as Texas A&M Track & Field shines at the Corky Classic
description: Texas A&M sets three school records, 39 top‚Äëten finishes, and 19 medalists during a solid showing at the Corky Classic.
fullText:
Records are meant to be broken, and the Texas A&M Aggies wasted no time proving it at the Corky Classic in Lubbock. Several members of the Aggie Track & Field program made history over the weekend, setting the tone for what could be a special indoor campaign.

Texas A&M opened the season with force, stacking up 39 top‚Äëten finishes, 19 medalists, and multiple athletes climbing the program‚Äôs all‚Äëtime performer lists.

The first breakthrough came from senior thrower Henry Zimmerman, who delivered a school‚Äërecord performance in the weight throw. His final attempt‚Äî21.88m (71‚Äë9.5)‚Äîsecured second overall and made him the top collegiate finisher in the field.

Freshman pole vaulter Lily Carlson followed with a statement of her own. Competing in just her second collegiate meet, Carlson cleared 4.41m (14‚Äë5.5) to break the Texas A&M indoor record previously held by All‚ÄëAmerican Heather Abadie. She claimed gold with a dominant seven‚Äëinch margin over the next closest competitor.

The record‚Äësetting weekend wrapped on the final day when freshman distance runner Peter Narumbe delivered one of the fastest 1,000m races in NCAA history. His time of 2:19.88 not only broke Luca Santorum‚Äôs school record‚Äîit also stands as the 17th‚Äëfastest 1,000m ever recorded at the collegiate level. His gold‚Äëmedal finish ranks him third all‚Äëtime among NCAA freshmen.

While Texas A&M is traditionally known for its outdoor prowess, this year‚Äôs squad has the depth and talent to be a real factor indoors and in the SEC race. The Aggies return to action on January 25, hosting the Ted Nelson Invitational at the Fasken Indoor Track & Field facility.

Contact/Follow us¬†@AggiesWire¬†on X and like our page on¬†Facebook¬†to follow ongoing coverage of Texas A&M news, notes, and opinions. Follow Jarrett Johnson on X:¬†@whosnextsports1.

title: Where Penn State ranks in On3's way-too-early top 25 for 2026 season
description: Penn State could have a bounce-back season in 2026 and may be on the College Football Playoff bubble according to this early ranking from On3.
fullText:
With the book officially closed on the 2025 college football season and a new national champion having been crowned, it is now time to shift our focus to the 2026 college football season. It's never too early for that, right? As is typically the case when the season comes to a close, the tradition of way-too-early top-25 projections are making the rounds already, and one of the more interesting teams to scout on these lists will be Penn State.

Following a program-changing 2025 season with an in-season coaching change and the hiring of Matt Campbell to steer the ship back on course, and with a massive offseason roster overhaul as a result, Penn State may be a difficult team for many to accurately project in the 2026 season. But that will not stop anyone from attempting to gauge where the Nittany Lions will be sitting next season. If one way-too-early top-25 list from On3 is any indication, Penn State could be on the College Football Playoff bubble next fall.

On3 released its way-too-early top-25 list and gave Penn State a No. 14 projection. Putting Penn State somewhere in the middle of any top-25 projection feels somewhat fair given the changes wiht the program and puts some trust in Campbell to turn things around from Penn State's 2025 season. It also feels like a pretty safe projection to suggest Penn State could be in the playoff hunt but may fall just outside of it.

Ohio State tops the On3 top-25 outlook, followed by Georgia, Texas, and Notre Dame, respectively. 2025 national champion Indiana takes the No. 5 slot in the On3 way-too-early top-25, with Oregon right behind the Hoosiers to give the Big Ten three top-10 teams in this projection. Michigan is the only other Big Ten team ranked ahead of Penn State, at No. 11.

Other Big Ten teams ranked in On3's early projection are Washington (No. 18), USC (No. 19), and Iowa (No. 21). Penn State will play road games next season at Michigan and Washington and will host USC. The Nittany Lions will not face Ohio State, Indiana, or Oregon during the regular season in 2026. Also of note, On3 also ranks Virginia Tech, now coached by former Penn State head coach James Franklin, at No. 23.

title: 'Cool Runnings' sequel? Jamaica bobsled teams make 2026 Winter Olympics
description: Jamaica has qualified three bobsleds for the 2026 Winter Olympics in February, stirring memories of a "Cool Runnings" sequel.
fullText:
It could be time for a sequel to ‚ÄúCool Runnings,‚Äô‚Äô the movie inspired by the 1998 Winter Olympic debut of the Jamaican bobsled team..

The Jamaicans have become more than a feel-good Olympics story.

They have qualified for three bobsled spots at the upcoming 2026 Winter Olympics in Milano Cortina, Italy, the Jamaican Bobsleigh & Skeleton Federation announced Jan. 19. Jamaicans qualified three sleds for the first time at the 2022 Winter Olympics in Beijing,

The contigent qualified to compete in Italy are the two-man team, four-man team and women‚Äôs monobob, according to the Jamaican federation, which announced the two-woman team is ranked as first alternate should another country withdraw from competiton.

‚ÄúThis achievement reflects sustained excellence, commitment and international competitiveness on the world stage,‚Äô‚Äô the federation said.

title: Valverde's 23 for Bergamo: no Williams, Vesga and Serrano included
description: Athletic Club has officially announced the squad list for the crucial Champions League match against Atalanta in Bergamo.After a final training session marked by uncertainty, Ernesto Valverde has put ...
fullText:
Athletic Club has officially announced the squad list for the crucial Champions League match against Atalanta in Bergamo.

After a final training session marked by uncertainty, Ernesto Valverde has put together a group of 23 players, shaped by significant absences, especially in the attack and on the flanks.

The main negative news is confirmed by the absence of key players such as I√±aki Williams, Nico Williams, Berenguer, and Yuri Berchiche. These four footballers, fundamental pillars in the offensive and defensive schemes of the "lions," are not included in the final list to travel to Italy.

Aymeric Laporte is also missing from the squad, a loss that weakens the heart of the defense. These absences will force the team to reinvent itself in a high-stakes European setting where effectiveness will be crucial.

On the positive side, the squad list includes the return of Mikel Vesga and the presence of Nico Serrano, who has ultimately been included in the coach‚Äôs plans despite initial doubts.

Additionally, the inclusion of Andoni Gorosabel stands out, as he strengthens the right flank in a list where the experience of players like Unai Sim√≥n, Lekue, or Galarreta will be vital to guide the younger players in the hostile environment of Bergamo.

Faced with a wave of injuries, Valverde has firmly backed the talent from Lezama. The squad features a strong representation of youngsters and players registered with the reserve team such as Padilla, Santos, Jon de Luis, Rego, Ibon S√°nchez, Selton, Hierro, and Adri√°n P√©rez.

This commitment to the youth academy is not just a necessity, but also an opportunity for the jewels of the red-and-white structure to make their debut or establish themselves in the top continental competition against one of Serie A‚Äôs most tactical opponents.

title: Robert Saleh plans to call defensive plays with Tennessee Titans
description: Incoming Tennessee Titans head coach Robert Saleh intends to call defensive plays in 2026, something he did not do with the New York Jets.
fullText:
Robert Saleh‚Äôs impending tenure as Tennessee Titans head coach comes with an unusual wrinkle for the franchise: He plans to call defensive plays himself, a responsibility he did not carry as head coach of the New York Jets.

New #Titans HC Robert Saleh indicated to teams in interviews that he plans to call defensive plays in his next stop as HC, per sources. 

That wasn‚Äôt the case in his #Jets tenure. https://t.co/9hjhYCjkh7 pic.twitter.com/TtdMqrn1AA

‚Äî Jordan Schultz (@Schultz_Report) January 20, 2026

Saleh‚Äôs decision to take on defensive play-calling signals that he wants more direct control of the side of the ball that has defined his career. As San Francisco‚Äôs defensive coordinator, Saleh built a reputation as a top defensive mind, and Tennessee clearly hopes to lean on that expertise to upgrade a defense that struggled with consistency last season.

But Saleh‚Äôs choice also raises the stakes on his offensive coordinator hire.

With Saleh focused on defense, Tennessee must land a top-tier offensive play-caller -- not only to manage game strategy but to help develop rookie quarterback Cam Ward, the 2025 No. 1 overall pick.

Ward showed promise as a rookie, but his continued growth likely hinges on having an OC who can design and call an effective offense. Saleh‚Äôs expanded role gives him control where he‚Äôs strongest, but success in Nashville will depend on pairing that with elite offensive leadership.

This article originally appeared on Titans Wire: Robert Saleh plans to call defensive plays with Tennessee Titans

title: Victorious Sinner sees 'room to improve' on serve
description: Jannik Sinner says he does not feel "very safe" with changes he has made to his serve, despite needing just 68 minutes to start his Australian Open title defence.
fullText:
Jannik Sinner says he does not yet "feel very safe" with the changes he has made to his serve after starting his Australian Open title defence with a shortened first-round win against Hugo Gaston.

The world number two and two-time defending Australian Open champion was in full control of the match at 6-2 6-1 up when Frenchman Gaston abruptly retired.

Sinner led the way on percentage of service games won on the ATP Tour during 2025 (92%) but feels there is still "a lot of room to improve".

Asked about changes he has made since his US Open final loss to Carlos Alcaraz in September, the 24-year-old Italian said: "I felt like the serve was and still is a shot where I need to improve.

"We changed the motion a little bit, the rhythm of the serve. Before, it was a bit too fast in the beginning, now it's a bit slower.

"At times I still lose it. It's not a shot I feel very safe with, but we are working on that.

"It is one of, if not the most, important shots we have because it can give you so many great things."

Boulter outclassed in straight-set loss to Bencic

'Timid' Keys overcomes nerves to start title defence

How popularity overwhelmed Eala - and the Australian Open

Apart from the opening game of the match, when he recovered from 0-40 down to hold serve, Sinner was rarely troubled by world number 93 Gaston.

Playing his first official match since winning the ATP Tour Finals in November, Sinner sent down three aces and an unreturnable serve during a run of five consecutive points to avoid that early break.

He lost only nine more points behind his serve in the remainder of the match, served six aces in all and did not commit a double fault, ending with a first-serve percentage of 64%.

Four-time Grand Slam champion Sinner reeled off four consecutive breaks of serve as he won nine games in a row, moving from 2-2 in the first set to the brink of a two-set lead.

Gaston avoided a second-set bagel by holding serve at 5-0 down but the left-hander, who briefly received treatment at the end of the first set, elected to end the match after losing the second.

"Obviously it's not the way you want to win the match. I wish him a speedy recovery and hope it's nothing too bad," added Sinner, who will face Australian wildcard James Duckworth in round two.

Gael Monfils' 20th and final Australian Open appearance ended in a first-round defeat by Australian qualifier Dane Sweeny.

The 39-year-old Frenchman, who will retire at the end of the season, was restricted physically in the latter part of the match but remained competitive, despite struggling to move freely.

Monfils went 4-1 up with a break in the fourth set but then lost six of the next seven games as Sweeny sealed a 6-7 (3-7) 7-5 6-4 7-5 win in three hours and 51 minutes.

"Somehow it's the finish line," Monfils told the crowd after his loss.

"Thank you so much for this amazing ride, you guys have been unbelievable.

"I've got a lot of great memories here, some big battles, even today was almost four hours.

"I've been very grateful and very lucky to play here for many years."

Elsewhere, Italian fifth seed Lorenzo Musetti led by two sets to one when his Belgian opponent Raphael Collignon retired injured in the fourth set.

Eighth seed Ben Shelton, a semi-finalist at Melbourne last year, won 6-3 7-6 (7-2) 7-6 (7-5) against Frenchman Ugo Humbert.

Fellow American Taylor Fritz, the ninth seed, and 16th seed Jakub Mensik also made it through to the second round in four and five sets respectively.

However, teenage Brazilian star Joao Fonseca appeared to be hampered by a back injury in a four-set loss to world number 85 Eliot Spizzirri of the United States, while Bulgaria's Grigor Dimitrov was another to make an early exit, beaten in 6-4 6-4 6-3 by Czech player Tomas Machac.

Father-to-be Ruud ready to leave Melbourne early

Djokovic registers 100th Australian Open win

title: Boulter outclassed in straight-set loss to Bencic
description: Katie Boulter exits the Australian Open after being outclassed by Belinda Bencic in a straight-set first-round loss in Melbourne.
fullText:
Great Britain's Katie Boulter exited the Australian Open after being outclassed by Belinda Bencic in a straight-set first-round loss in Melbourne.

Boulter, the world number 113 after an inconsistent 2025, was a last-minute entry into the main draw following a withdrawal - which spared her from having to compete in qualifying.

Handed a tough opening match, she could not initially compete with Swiss 10th seed Bencic and conceded the first set in just 26 minutes, without winning a game.

Boulter offered much sterner resistance in set two, breaking her opponent's serve for the first time to level at 4-4, but she could not force a decider.

Bencic, a two-time major semi-finalist, completed a 6-0 7-5 win and will meet Australia's Daria Kasatkina or Czech teenager Nikola Bartunkova next.

Speaking after her loss, Boulter said she was looking forward to trying to rediscover some form and would contest lower-level tournaments on the WTA Tour to do so.

"Ultimately last year was very bitty, so I never really found I got that rhythm of match play," Boulter said.

"I'm very excited to go and play some tournaments, even lower ones. I think it will be great for me to do."

How popularity overwhelmed Eala - and the Australian Open

'Timid' Keys overcomes nerves to start title defence

Boulter endured a difficult 2025, dropping from 24th in the world to outside the top 100, and lost her British number one ranking amid injury struggles.

Seeking a fresh start this season, the Briton ended her partnership with long-term coach Biljana Veselinovic and is now being assisted by American Michael Joyce, who helped Maria Sharapova win two Grand Slams and reach world number one.

It is also a significant year for Boulter away from the court, with her wedding to Australian tennis star Alex de Minaur planned for later in 2026.

Speaking before the tournament, Boulter said: "I'm getting married this year. It's going to be an unbelievable year, one of the best ones in my life, no matter what happens on the tennis court.

"I think for me that's already given me a positive push."

She added: "I feel like having a new coach, having a new set-up, everything is fresh and exciting again. Whereas I feel like I was dragging my feet a little bit at the end of last year just trying to get through the whole entire year without injuries."

Now British number four, Boulter has won only four tour-level matches since Wimbledon.

She tore an abductor in her final event of last year in Hong Kong and returned to action at the ASB Classic in Auckland earlier this month, losing in the second round.

Father-to-be Ruud ready to leave Melbourne early

Victorious Sinner sees 'room to improve' on serve

title: ACC Roundup - The Pack Could Use A Big Win But Clemson Is A Tough Place To Get It
description: Despair is a big factor in ACC Basketball and for some teams, it‚Äôs creeping closer.
fullText:
In Tuesday‚Äôs ACC Action, NC State treks down to Clemson, Florida State is off to Miami and SMU visits Wake Forest.

We started to say that Will Wade was making his first trip to Clemson, but of course he went to school there and started his coaching career there as well.

It‚Äôs not like he‚Äôs going to Littlejohn without knowing that it‚Äôs a pit. He knows exactly what Littlejohn is.

That said, State has been up and down and Wade is frustrated. Clemson has been playing really well so it‚Äôs hard to bet against them at home, but State needs to get an impressive win to make up for losing to Georgia Tech on Saturday.

Side note: Wade beat Clemson when he was at McNeese in last year‚Äôs NCAA Tournament.

Incidentally, Clemson fans have taken to calling Carter Welling ‚Äúthe Mormon Missile.‚Äù He says he doesn‚Äôt mind and actually sounds kind of flattered.

FSU probably is going to Miami at the wrong time. The ‚ÄòCanes took a beating at Clemson last time out and they‚Äôre going to want to take some frustrations out on somebody and the ‚ÄòNoles are a handy target.

Both coaches are new of course, but Jai Lucas had an easier time recruiting in his first season. Luke Loucks has done a decent job at Florida State, but that‚Äôs going to take some time. Miami is heavily favored and should be. They‚Äôre much more talented than FSU.

SMU is visiting Wake but the Mustangs are much more talented and unlike the Demon Deacons, they have a reliable inside game. Wake has three players who can be counted on in Juke Harris, Myles Colvin and Nate Calmese, and Tre‚ÄôVon Spillers has had his moments. But we can‚Äôt see Omaha Biliew and Cooper Schweiger keeping up with Samet Yigitoglu and Jaden Toombs.

At UNC, aside from the Hubert Davis drama, the university is trying to decide whether to stay in the Dean Dome and renovate or build a fancy new barn which might be off campus.

Davis and some other prominent alums have come out firmly for renovating and now you can add Ol‚Äô Roy Williams to that camp.

In this video, Williams invokes the father figure of Dean Smith, saying that Smith always wanted an on-campus arena. Smith‚Äôs aura is fading a bit, but Williams still carries some weight. Mission accomplished?

title: Why was Brandon Beane promoted? Inside Bills GM's history of poor draft picks, free-agent signings since Josh Allen
description: Here is more on why the Bills chose to fire Sean McDermott, but retained GM Brandon Beane.
fullText:
Why was Brandon Beane promoted? Inside Bills GM's history of poor draft picks, free-agent signings since Josh Allen originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

On Monday, the Buffalo Bills decided to fire head coach Sean McDermott ‚Äî but not general manager Brandon Beane.

The move came as the Bills once again came up short in the postseason. There were controversial calls, but nonetheless, Buffalo lost to the Denver Broncos in overtime of their divisional round matchup. The loss moved McDermott to 8-8 in the postseason and marked another year he didn't reach the Super Bowl.

Given the franchise's continued falling short of expectations, there was a chance¬†the head coach's firing signified that Buffalo would clean house. Instead, Beane was retained. In team owner Terry Pegula's statement about McDermott's termination, it was revealed that Beane would actually be getting a slight promotion to¬†President of Football Operations/General Manager.

Here is more on why the Bills elected to retain Beane instead of firing him with McDermott.

MORE: Why did the Bills fire Sean McDermott?

Buffalo chose not to fire Beane with McDermott. Instead, he received his promotion.

In Pegula's statement about McDermott's firing, he cited that "Brandon [Beane] will oversee all facets of our football operation, including the oversight of our coaching staff. I have full faith in and have witnessed Brandon's outstanding leadership style and have confidence in his abilities to lead our organization."

The #Bills make it official: Sean McDermott is out pic.twitter.com/1IJZrWiXh6

‚Äî Ian Rapoport (@RapSheet) January 19, 2026

MORE: What's next for Sean McDermott after Bills firing?

Beane was hired as the Buffalo GM ahead of the 2017 season. Since then, he has had nine draft classes. Some of them have been full of hits like in 2018 when he drafted Josh Allen, Tremaine Edmunds, Harrison Phillips, Taron Johnson and Wyatt Teller.

Other drafts, like 2021, were rough outings for Beane as half of the class ended up playing fewer than two seasons in the NFL.

2 -- WR Zay Jones, East Carolina

5 -- LB Matt Milano, Boston College

5 -- QB Nathan Peterman, Pittsburgh

6 -- LB Tanner Vallejo, Boise St.

2017 is a pretty solid example of what Beane brings to the table. He hit on White, who has gone on to play 109 career games, with 98 of them coming with the Bills. Dawkins has spent all of his nine-year career with Buffalo and has developed into one of the more reliable offensive linemen in the league. Guys like Jones and Peterman spent more time in their careers away from the Bills as opposed to with them.

1 -- MLB Tremaine Edmunds, Virginia Tech

3 -- DT Harrison Phillips, Stanford

4 -- CB Taron Johnson, Weber St.

5 -- CB Siran Neal, Jacksonville St.

5 -- OG Wyatt Teller, Virginia Tech

6 -- WR Ray-Ray McCloud, Clemson

7 -- WR Austin Proehl, North Carolina

This has been one of Beane's best draft classes. Buffalo took Allen with the No. 7 pick and he has developed into their franchise quarterback and has won an MVP Award. Edmunds spent five years with the Bills before signing with the Chicago Bears. Similarly, Phillips played out his rookie deal with the Bills and signed elsewhere in free agency. Teller played only one year in Buffalo before he was traded to the Cleveland Browns.

3 -- RB Devin Singletary, Florida Atlantic

7 -- DE Darryl Johnson, North Carolina A&T

7 -- TE Tommy Sweeney, Boston College

This was a problematic class for Beane and the Bills. Oliver was a great start and remains with Buffalo after seven years, as does Knox. Ford was in Buffalo for three years, Singletary for four, Johnson for four (has been out of the league since), Johnson for two, Sweeney for three (has been out of the league since) and Joseph never played. Outside of Oliver and Knox, this class lacked longevity in Buffalo.

MORE: Ranking the greatest Bills of all time

4 -- WR Gabe Davis, Central Florida

6 -- K Tyler Bass, Georgia Southern

6 -- WR Isaiah Hodgins, Oregon St.

7 -- CB Dane Jackson, Pittsburgh

This was a good draft class for Beane. Epenesa continues to be a solid defender for Buffalo, as does Jackson. Davis has had solid seasons, as has Bass though both have struggled recently. The big misses from this class were Moss and Fromm, who didn't last long in Buffalo.

1 -- DL Gregory Rousseau, Miami

2 -- DL Boogie Basham, Wake Forest

3 -- OL Spencer Brown, Northern Iowa

5 -- OL Tommy Doyle, Miami (OH)

6 -- WR Marquez Stevenson, Houston

6 -- DB¬†Damar Hamlin, Pittsburgh

6 -- CB Rachad Wildgoose, Wisconsin

7 -- OL Jack Anderson, Texas Tech

Rousseau remains in Buffalo and has 32 career sacks, and Brown continues to be a starting member of the offensive line when healthy. Basham only lasted two seasons with the Bills, while Doyle, Stevenson, Wildgoose and Anderson have all played fewer than two seasons in the league. Hamlin has been a productive depth piece after being drafted in the sixth round.

5 -- WR Khalil Shakir, Boise St.

6 -- P Matt Araiza, San Diego St.

6 -- DB Christian, Benford, Villanova

6 -- OL Luke Tenuta, Virginia Tech

7 -- LB Baylor Spector, Clemson

The 2022 draft was another solid one for Beane and Buffalo. Cook, Bernard, Benford and Shakir remain starters when healthy. Cook has developed into one of the best running backs in the NFL, and Shakir led the Bills in receiving in 2025.

Elam was a pretty big miss. He played in 29 games over three years and had just two interceptions before being cut ahead of the 2025 season. Araiza had off-field issues arise and never played for the Bills. He has since returned to the NFL, but is the punter for the Kansas City Chiefs. Tenuta never played with the Bills and Spector is a depth piece still on the roster.

MORE: When is the last time the Bills won a Super Bowl?

2 -- OL O'Cyrus Torrence, Florida

3 -- LB Dorian Williams, Tulane

5 -- WR Justin Shorter, Florida

7 -- DB Alex Austin, Oregon St.

This was the fewest number of picks that Buffalo had in a draft in Beane's tenure. Kincaid remains the starting tight end when healthy. Torrence has started all but one game since the Bills drafted him. Williams remains a depth linebacker for the Bills, but Shorter, Broeker and Austin never played a game for Buffalo and are all on different teams if they are still in the league.

2 -- WR Keon Coleman, Florida State

5 -- OL Sedrick Van Pran-Granger, Georgia

5 -- LB Edefuan Ulofoshio, Washington

6 -- OL Tylan Grable, Central Florida

6 -- CB Daequan Hardy, Penn State

Coleman won the hearts of Bills fans in his opening press conference, but by his second season was already being listed as a healthy scratch for disciplinary reasons. Bishop started all 17 games for the Bills in 2025, but Carter missed the entire season due to a torn Achilles tendon in the preseason.

Davis is the primary backup running back for Cook. The others are mainly depth pieces, but Hardy and Clayton are no longer on the team.

MORE:¬†Inside Keon Coleman's timeline of trouble in Buffalo

1 -- CB Maxwell Hairston, Kentucky

2¬†-- DT T.J. Sanders, South Carolina

3 -- DE Landon Jackson, Arkansas

5 -- S Jordan Hancock, Ohio State

5 -- TE Jackson Hawes, Georgia Tech

6 -- CB Dorian Strong, Virginia Tech

6 -- OL Chase Lundt, Connecticut

7 -- WR Kaden Prather, Maryland

Prather is the only member of this draft class who didn't appear in a game in their rookie season. Only Walker and Hawes saw action in all 17 games. Hairston had two interceptions and 18 tackles, while Sanders had seven tackles and a sack, with both expected to take a step forward in 2026.

Allen was drafted with Buffalo's first-round pick in the 2018 NFL Draft. He was selected seventh overall and was the third quarterback drafted in the class. Baker Mayfield was chosen first by the Cleveland Browns, and the New York Jets took Sam Darnold third. Allen was the third of five quarterbacks drafted in the first round that year, along with Josh Rosen (10th) and Lamar Jackson (32nd).

MORE: Inside Sean McDermott's career coaching timeline

If GMs aren't able to hit in the draft, their next option is to sign free agents. The Bills have been scrutinized recently for not paying for a dominant wide receiver for Allen to lean on in the offense, but that isn't the only miss for their recent years of free agency.

Beane made a splash in the 2017 offseason bringing in a pair of safeties on huge contracts. Hyde was signed to a five-year deal worth $30.5 million, while Poyer inked a four-year, $13 million deal. They developed into a dominant safety tandem, that played together through the 2023 season when Hyde retired.

McGovern was a big signing for Buffalo as the offensive lineman was signed to a three-year, $22.35 million deal. He played in all but two games for the Bills over the course of the deal and should be a player that Beane and Buffalo want to re-sign for the 2026 season and beyond.

MORE: Revisiting the Bills' four consecutive Super Bowl losses

Beane and the Bills signed defensive end Von Miller to a massive six-year, $120 million deal ahead of the 2022 NFL season. The pass-rusher was 33 years old at the time, and the contract was expected to have him in Buffalo through his age 39 season. Miller had eight sacks in 11 games in 2020 before tearing his ACL. He only had six sacks over his next 25 games. Miller was released after three years.

The Bills have been unable to lock down a top-end wide receiver for Allen. To add wide receiver depth, Buffalo signed veteran wide receiver Curtis Samuel to a three-year, $24 million deal ahead of the 2024 season. Injuries have derailed his Bills tenure, but he has played in 20 games over the last two seasons and has combined for 334 yards and two touchdowns.

Addison was signed to a three-year, $30.45 million deal ahead of the 2020 season. The then-33-year-old played in two seasons with Buffalo and had 59 tackles with 12 sacks. He was released after the 2021 season and signed with the Houston Texans.

title: Roma working on Fortini and Tel
description: Today, Tuesday, January 20th, we‚Äôll know more about the final days of the transfer window for Roma. As Il Messaggero reports, a meeting is scheduled between Gian Piero Gasperini, Frederic Massara, a...
fullText:
Today, Tuesday, January 20th, we‚Äôll know more about the final days of the transfer window for Roma.

Tottenham have excluded him from the UEFA list, and the Frenchman is reportedly looking to leave London. In the Netherlands, they‚Äôre eyeing Ajax‚Äôs Mika Godts and Feyenoord‚Äôs Leo Sauer. As for the latter, his father‚Äôs denials aren‚Äôt particularly alarming.

title: Life-sized Ballesteros statue goes missing
description: Spanish authorities are investigating after a bronze statue commemorating five-time major winner Seve Ballesteros disappears in his hometown in Spain.
fullText:
A life-sized statue commemorating five-time major winner Seve Ballesteros has gone missing from his hometown of Pedrena in Spain.

Spanish authorities are investigating after Marina de Cudeyo town council said on Instagram that the "unfortunate event" at the weekend indicates the statue was stolen.

Spaniard Ballesteros, who helped Europe win five Ryder Cups, died of brain cancer in 2011 at the age of 54.

"If anyone has observed suspicious movements, especially in the last 24 hours, please let the Civil Guard or the local police know," the council said.

The bronze statue was created in 2009 by sculptor Salvador Garcia Ceballos and was permanently installed in La Barqueria Park in 2017.

It captures the moment Ballesteros celebrated a famous victory at the Open Championship at St Andrews in 1984.

Ballesteros was trailing Tom Watson in the final round but came back to win by two shots and claim the Claret Jug, denying the American a third successive Open.

Pedrena is near Santander in the Cantabria region in northern Spain.

title: Chelsea trio back in training ahead of Champions League game
description: Chelsea trio Jamie Gittens, Estevao and Malo Gusto all took part in team training ahead of the Champions League clash with Pafos.All three missed the Blues‚Äô win over Brentford on Saturday but look s...
fullText:
Chelsea trio Jamie Gittens, Estevao and Malo Gusto all took part in team training ahead of the Champions League clash with Pafos.

All three missed the Blues‚Äô win over Brentford on Saturday but look set to return to the squad when they host the Cypriot side at Stamford Bridge on Wednesday night.

Estevao had been struggling with illness, with boss Liam Rosenior saying after the win over Brentford: ‚ÄúYeah, he was ill. It‚Äôs running through the squad. There were a few, I won‚Äôt say who, but there were a couple of players playing today who were complaining about their chests.‚Äù

Axel Disasi also took part in training having been frozen out of the first-team picture this season.

But fellow defender Tosin was not involved after suffering an injury against Brentford.

title: Marseille in talks with Arsenal over Nwaneri loan
description: French club Marseille are in talks to sign Arsenal midfielder Ethan Nwaneri on loan for the rest of the season.
fullText:
French club Marseille are in talks to sign Arsenal midfielder Ethan Nwaneri on loan for the rest of the season.

Discussions about a deal are ongoing with a loan fee one of the aspects of the deal being worked on.

BBC Sport previously reported that Nwaneri was not expected to go on loan this season with the original feeling from both club and player being that the 18-year-old would benefit by being part of a squad that is challenging for a title.

However, the prospect of playing football in another league and country while getting regular game time is a scenario that is appealing to the player.

The England Under-21 international has made just 12 appearances for the Gunners in all competitions, starting four games but none in the Premier League, and has scored once this season in the Carabao Cup.

Nwaneri signed a new contract in the summer until 2030, but has found his route into the first team challenged by the signings of Noni Madueke for ¬£48.5m and Eberechi Eze for ¬£67m.

Nwaneri's taste of regular minutes last season has raised his expectations and having to fight for game time at a club like Arsenal has not surprised him, but with two England internationals ahead of him, regular minutes have been hard to come by.

Eze himself has struggled to break into the Arsenal starting XI in recent weeks and has played 23 minutes in the Gunners last six Premier League games. He has been an unused substitute in four of those matches.

Last season, Nwaneri played mostly on the right wing and scored nine goals in 37 appearances in all competitions to mark himself out as one of England's most talented young players.

But with Madueke the first choice as back up to Bukayo Saka and Eze the number 10 to challenge captain Martin Odegaard, the two positions Nwaneri would fit into have become harder to get.

What next for Nwaneri after season of frustration?

Arsenal are having an excellent season and are seven points clear at the top of the Premier League, have an 100% record in the Champions League and are in the semi-finals of the Carabao Cup with a lead over Chelsea from the first leg.

The Gunners are hoping to end their wait for a trophy this season and have signed a number of players including midfielder Martin Zubimendi, Eze and - despite his struggles - striker Viktor Gyokeres as "win now" signings.

That has meant that manager Mikel Arteta has looked at using players with experience to get results with Odegaard and Zubimendi preferred in midfield, while the Spaniard has favoured both Riccardo Calafiori and Piero Hincapie at left-back this season.

Hincapie has experience of winning a league title after being part of the Bayer Leverkusen side that won the Bundesliga in 2023-24.

That has made things difficult for Nwaneri's fellow academy graduate Myles Lewis-Skelly.

Lewis-Skelly also took his chance during Arsenal's injury crisis last season, making 42 appearances in all competitions, including playing in both games of the impressive Champions League quarter-final win over Real Madrid.

Lewis-Skelly's performances were so good that he was given an England debut by Thomas Tuchel, scoring against Albania in a 2-0 win and looked set to be the Three Lions' starting left-back at the World Cup.

Game time hasn't been as hard to come by for Lewis-Skelly and he has started nine of his 23 appearances this season, but he has started just once in the Premier League and has dropped out of the England squad.

It is always going to be hard for young players to break through from the academy into the first team at a club like Arsenal without any dips in form.

But after two excellent breakthrough seasons for Lewis-Skelly and Nwaneri, it looks as though development path will be slightly different to what the pair imagined at the beginning of the season.

title: New York Giants' John Harbaugh addresses Todd Monken as possible OC
description: New York Giants head coach John Harbaugh would like to add Todd Monken as offensive coordinator but admits there's much uncertainty.
fullText:
New York Giants head coach John Harbaugh is wasting no time reshaping his coaching staff ahead of his official introduction on Tuesday.

While reports earlier this month indicated that former Baltimore Ravens offensive coordinator Todd Monken was expected to follow Harbaugh to East Rutherford -- pending Rooney Rule interviews for the position -- the situation has grown uncertain.

Speaking to the New York Post on Monday, Harbaugh remained cautious about Monken's potential role as offensive coordinator.

"We'll see, can‚Äôt really say right now, there's a lot of moving parts," Harbaugh said. "He's interviewing [Tuesday] for the Browns head coaching job, so there's a lot of balls still up in the NFL, that's for sure. Look at today, man. Crazy."

Harbaugh plans to meet with members of Brian Daboll‚Äôs former staff this week to evaluate possible retentions, though significant changes are anticipated.

The Giants have also requested permission to interview Vikings passing game coordinator Daronte Jones for their defensive coordinator vacancy.

This article originally appeared on Giants Wire: New York Giants' John Harbaugh addresses Todd Monken as possible OC

title: üèÜ Gran Canaria to host the 2026 Copa de la Reina final
description: Spanish women's football already has its next major destination marked in red. The Royal Spanish Football Federation (RFEF) has officially confirmed that the Estadio de Gran Canaria will be the venue ...
fullText:
Spanish women's football already has its next major destination marked in red. The Royal Spanish Football Federation (RFEF) has officially confirmed that the Estadio de Gran Canaria will be the venue for the grand final of the Copa de SM la Reina Iberdrola, which will take place on May 16, 2026.

This announcement is the result of a strategic agreement between the RFEF, the Cabildo of Gran Canaria, and the Inter-island Federation of Las Palmas, establishing the island as a top-level sports reference.

The choice of this venue is no coincidence, as the Estadio de Gran Canaria boasts a modern infrastructure following its renovation in 2014. With a capacity for over 32,000 spectators, the Canary fortress is preparing to register a historic attendance.

The venue already has experience hosting international events for the Spanish national team, ensuring that the pitch conditions and services will be up to the standards of one of the most prestigious trophies on the national calendar.

This event comes at a time of absolute splendor for women's football in our country. With the Spanish national team leading the FIFA rankings and following recent success in the UEFA Women‚Äôs Nations League, the interest in seeing the best players in the world is at its peak.

This article was translated into English by Artificial Intelligence. You can read the original version in üá™üá∏ here.

title: Why Xabi Alonso won‚Äôt become Man Utd manager this summer, according to journalist
description: Xabi Alonso is being mentioned as a candidate for the Manchester United job following his recent dismissal from Real Madrid, which ended after just seven months in charge. Ruben Amorim was let go by United after just over a year in charge.
fullText:
Xabi Alonso is being mentioned as a candidate for the Manchester United job following his recent dismissal from Real Madrid, which ended after just seven months in charge.

Ruben Amorim was let go by United after just over a year in charge. His exit came at the same time as two other high-profile departures from top European clubs, Chelsea and Real Madrid.

Now out of work, Amorim is part of a growing group of available coaches. Other big names on that list include Enzo Maresca and Xabi Alonso.

Maresca is well-known as a prot√©g√© of Pep Guardiola, having previously made a name for himself at Leicester City in the Championship. Alonso is another potential option, although his exit from Madrid was reportedly due to clashes with both the board and dressing room.

The wider wave of dismissals gives United more options if they want to avoid additional compensation fees.

United fans expect Ineos to avoid penny-pinching or shortcuts when appointing a permanent head coach, especially after questionable decisions by Sir Jim Ratcliffe and his chiefs since taking control of football operations at Old Trafford.

Alonso is expected to look for a fresh challenge following his brief spell with Real Madrid.

His Bayer Leverkusen side ran away with the Bundesliga title in 2022‚Äì23, and even though things did not work out at Madrid, his reputation around Europe is still strong.

Having spent five years at Anfield during his playing days, some might question whether he would ever consider a move to Old Trafford. Sir Matt Busby famously made that leap in the past, but it is unclear if the Spaniard would follow that path.

ESPN‚Äôs Mark Ogden addressed the rumours on The Football Reporters podcast after speaking with contacts about whether United were actually interested in bringing him in.

‚ÄúBut I just want to kind of drop something that I was told last week,‚Äù Ogden began by saying.

‚ÄúSo when the whole Man United situation was going off and I was speaking to somebody talking about United and just a kind of a cheeky little, ‚Äòwhy not consider Xabi Alonso?‚Äô

‚ÄúAnd obviously, I know the answer is that he played for Liverpool etc. But he was like, no, no, no, that‚Äôs not going to happen.

‚ÄúHe said, and the story that this guy had been told, and he has a bit of insight, was that they said, no, Xabi Alonso will end up at Bayern Munich this summer, and Vincent Kompany will go to Man City because Man City wants Vincent Kompany back and Xabi Alonso is an obvious fit for Bayern Munich.

‚ÄúBecause he‚Äôs as much of a legend as he is at Liverpool. He‚Äôs also a great at Bayern Munich.‚Äù

Ogden anticipates a managerial ‚Äúmerry-go-round,‚Äù potentially leading to Pep Guardiola‚Äôs departure from the Etihad Stadium.

Thierry Henry has suggested that Manchester United‚Äôs board needs to establish a clear direction before making any decisions about their next permanent manager.

Michael Carrick has been named interim head coach until the end of the season, but the next appointment will be a significant decision for Jason Wilcox and Omar Berrada to make.

Carrick‚Äôs tenure started well with a 2-0 win over Manchester City, thanks to goals from Bryan Mbeumo and Patrick Dorgu.

Speaking on Monday Night Football, Henry referenced his time at Barcelona, pointing out how the club‚Äôs strong sense of identity made managerial appointments much simpler.

‚ÄúThe reality is what do they want Man United to be?‚Äù Henry said on Sky Sports (via Daily Mail).

‚ÄúWhat do they want, I don‚Äôt feel it from the outside. I don‚Äôt feel whatever they are looking at.

‚ÄúBayern went to Vincent Kompany, we talked about Luis Enrique, we talked about Frank Rijkaard.

‚ÄúYou can agree of disagree, you can see what type of coaches they want. I don‚Äôt know at Man United, I really don‚Äôt know what they are about now, what they want to achieve and what is the DNA.

‚ÄúI am talking about now when I watch the games. What Michael Carrick did at the weekend was brilliant, but in two weeks we could be talking about something else.

‚ÄúWhat do they want, how are they going to go about it? It should be clear in order to get one of the guys we are talking about.

‚ÄúThe way they [Barcelona] see it on the other side, if you don‚Äôt fit who the house is, it doesn‚Äôt matter who you are or what you have done before.

‚ÄúIf you fit what we believe in, you can come. But what are you to make that decision.‚Äù

title: Roma ready to offer El Shaarawy in package deal for Fortini

fullText:
Roma‚Äôs transfer priorities are wingers. Mario Hermoso‚Äôs injury isn‚Äôt a concern, and signing a defender can wait.

Among the top targets of Frederic Massara and Gian Piero Gasperini is Fiorentina winger Niccol√≤ Fortini.

In addition to this, Roma have offered ‚Ç¨10 million for Fortini.

El Shaarawy‚Äôs possible move to Florence, linked to the Fortini deal, may not be the only exit from Roma in these final days of the winter transfer window.

Tommaso Baldanzi is ready for Genoa, while Kostas Tsimikas and Leon Bailey could return to Liverpool and Aston Villa, respectively.

title: Lawrence Stroll eyes ‚Äòfight for victories‚Äô in 2026 after Aston Martin F1 link-up with Honda
description: Aston Martin have a new power unit supplier this season, moving from Mercedes to Japanese giant Honda
fullText:
Lawrence Stroll believes Aston Martin and Honda‚Äôs new partnership have ‚Äúall the elements required to fight for victory‚Äù ahead of the 2026 F1 season.

Japanese giant Honda, who formerly worked with Red Bull for seven seasons, held their own launch event as the new power unit supplier for Aston in Tokyo on Tuesday.

Aston, who have F1 design guru Adrian Newey as their team principal this season, have long targeted 2026‚Äôs new era of regulations as a starting point to work their way up the ladder and compete for race wins and world championships, having moved on from using Mercedes engines.

This year‚Äôs car will be the first that Newey has fully worked on and, six weeks out from the season opener in Australia, team owner Lawrence Stroll ‚Äì father of driver Lance ‚Äìwas in an optimistic mood at the event in the Japanese capital.

He said: ‚ÄúThe strong collaboration between the AMR [Aston Martin Racing] Technology Centre at Silverstone and Honda Racing Corporation (HRC) in Sakura demonstrates the depth of our partnership. We are confident that we have all the elements required to fight for victory in the future and we have tremendous faith in Honda‚Äôs Power Unit and the engineers behind it.

‚ÄúOur journey won‚Äôt always be easy and challenges inevitably lie ahead, but winning is what drives both companies forward and together we look forward to many successful years of partnership.‚Äù

Aston Martin chief strategy officer Andy Cowell, whom Newey replaced as team boss at the end of last season, was also present at the event alongside F1 chief executive Stefano Domenicali.

Honda Motor Co. president Toshihiro Mibe added: ‚ÄúIn 2026, F1 will undergo a major change in regulations for both the chassis and power unit. Honda sees F1 as a symbol of challenge and innovation, and HRC, the global racing arm of Honda, has developed the RA626H, the new power unit for the 2026 season, to meet those challenges.

‚ÄúStriving to become number one in the world, Honda will continue to take on challenges together with the Aston Martin Aramco Formula One Team.‚Äù

Aston, who also have two-time world champion Fernando Alonso as one of their drivers, unveil their 2026 car at a launch event in Ithra, Saudi Arabia, on Monday 8 February.

All 11 teams will be present at a private testing session next week in Barcelona, before two official tests in Bahrain next month. The 2026 season starts in Melbourne on 8 March.

title: Inter Milan Vice-President On New Stadium: ‚ÄúImportant It‚Äôs Still In The San Siro District‚Äù
description: Inter Milan vice-president Javier Zanetti delivered his verdict on the San Siro project and shared his hopes for the future.Speaking to Sky Sports UK via FCInterNews, Zanetti shared his thoughts about...
fullText:
Inter Milan vice-president Javier Zanetti delivered his verdict on the San Siro project and shared his hopes for the future.

Speaking to Sky Sports UK via FCInterNews, Zanetti shared his thoughts about the club‚Äôs intention to build a state-of-the-art stadium.

AC Milan and Inter have embarked on their new stadium project after acquiring the land from the city.

Indeed, a brand-new stadium forms a key pillar of Oaktree‚Äôs long-term vision for the Nerazzurri.

Therefore, the clubs have earmarked substantial funds to finance this history-defining development.

Both teams are aiming to create a modern arena that will serve as a cornerstone for generations to come.

Meanwhile, renowned British architect Norman Foster will be in charge of construction, with the new stadium expected to open in 2031.

As such, there‚Äôs a good probability that San Siro will be among the venues to host the UEFA Euro 2032.

MILAN, ITALY ‚Äì APRIL 23: General view outside the stadium prior to the coppa Italia Semi Final match between FC Internazionale and AC Milan at Stadio Giuseppe Meazza San Siro on April 23, 2025 in Milan, Italy. (Photo by Marco Luzzani/Getty Images)

‚ÄúThe Meazza will always be a stadium that brings back memories. And it has brought many victories,‚Äù Javier Zanetti said.

‚ÄúEverything has changed,‚Äù he added. ‚ÄúI believe that a top club like Inter, known worldwide, needs a new, state-of-the-art stadium.

‚ÄúThe important thing is that it‚Äôs always at San Siro. I hope we‚Äôll be able to create special memories there as well.‚Äù

Finally, Zanetti named his most memorable game in the Nerazzurri shirt.

‚ÄúMy debut game,‚Äù he claimed. ‚ÄúI could never have imagined it would be the first of 858 matches.‚Äù

Zanetti spent his entire professional career in Europe at Inter. Indeed, he joined the club in 1995 and stayed here until 2014.

Upon retirement, the Nerazzurri retired his No.4 jersey, paying tribute to one of the most iconic figures in club history.

However, Zanetti couldn‚Äôt stay away from his beloved Inter, returning to the club in a different capacity shortly after hanging up his boots.

title: Lazio‚Äôs Nuno Tavares offered to Roma: Giallorossi not interested
description: Roma continues their search for a capable left wingback in this winter transfer window. Sporting director Frederic Massara is working to provide Gian Piero Gasperini with a new winger suited to his pl...
fullText:
Roma continues their search for a capable left wingback in this winter transfer window.

Sporting director Frederic Massara is working to provide Gian Piero Gasperini with a new winger suited to his playing system.

Among the candidates proposed in recent weeks is Nuno Tavares, currently playing for Lazio but not part of Maurizio Sarri‚Äôs coaching project.

The possibility of a sensational move to the Giallorossi has been suggested by intermediaries, as revealed by Radio Man√† Man√†.

However, Roma management have decided not to pursue the matter further, ruling out negotiations a priori.

Environmental and strategic considerations weighed on the decision, which led the club to not consider the Portuguese player as a viable option this transfer window.

With Nuno Tavares out of the running, Roma will continue their market search to identify an alternative more compatible with the coach‚Äôs tactical needs and the balance of the dressing room. The hottest names at the moment are Fiorentina‚Äôs Fortini and Tottenham‚Äôs Tel.

title: Analysis: How the GTD Pro field fared in the 'Roar before the 24'
description: In the GTD Pro class, three updated vehicles took the top spots of the pre-Daytona test ‚Äì as well as one intriguing outlier
fullText:
With 15 cars from 10 different manufacturers, GTD Pro is set to be fiercely contested at the 2026 24 Hours of Daytona. With three models (Ferrari 296, Ford Mustang, and Porsche 911) having received "Evo" updates, the Balance of Performance officials faced an uphill challenge in balancing the field.

Furthermore, in the GT3 classes, a certain amount of sandbagging is business as usual. No manufacturer wants to attract attention by showing too much pace during the pre-test. That‚Äôs why it is no surprise that three GTD cars posted a faster outright lap time than the best GTD Pro entry.

Looking at the six sessions of the "Roar before the 24" (only Winward Racing participated in the seventh session due to its Bronze-rated driver), it is safe to say that the #75 75 Express Mercedes ‚Äì driven by Kenny Habul, Maro Engel, Will Power Chaz Mostert ‚Äì fully disclosed what it is capable of.

Solar entrepreneur Habul‚Äôs team, which includes IndyCar superstar Power, secured four session best times.

Power caused a red flag in the first session with a minor spin, but otherwise remained error-free. 75 Express Racing also leads the cumulative standings.

The other two session bests went to the #59 RLL-McLaren (session 1) and the #4 Pratt-Miller-Corvette (session 4).

1. 75 Express Mercedes #75 (Habul/Engel/Power/Mostert) ‚Äì 1:47.530 (session 6)
2. Winward Mercedes #48 (Noble/Hart/Martin/Stolz) +0.115 (session 3)
3. Pfaff Lamborghini #9 (Caldarelli/Mitchell/Bortolotti/Hinchcliffe) +0.189 (session 3)
4. Multimatic Ford #65 (Mies/Vervisch/Priaulx) +0.230 (session 6)
5. RLL McLaren #59 (Esterson/N. Johnson/Vips/MacDonald) +0.236 (session 1)
6. Pratt Miller Corvette #3 (Garcia/Sims/Kirchhofer) +0.245 (session 6)
7. Pratt Miller Corvette #4 (Milner/Catsburg/Varrone) +0.280 (session 4)
8. GetSpeed Mercedes #69 (Bartone/Gotz/Gounon/Schiller) +0.321 (session 6)
9. Multimatic Ford #64 (Barker/Olsen/Rockenfeller) +0.333 (session 3)
10. Vasser Sullivan Lexus #14 (Hawksworth/Barnicoat/Kirkwood) +0.399 (session 6)
11. Risi Ferrari #62 (Serra/Rigon/Pier Guidi) +0.424 (session 4)
12. Manthey Porsche #911 (Preining/Bachler/Feller) +0.558 (session 4)
13. Triarsi Ferrari #033 (Calado/Agostini/Rovera/Molina) +0.618 (session 4)
14. Paul Miller BMW #1 (Verhagen/De Phillippi/Hesse/Harper) +0.879 (session 1)
15. AO Porsche #77 (Tandy/King/Picariello) +0.892 (session 3)

Habul set the best time of 1:47.530 ‚Äì a remarkable feat for a Bronze-rated driver. However, the personal bests of Power (1:47.612) and Mostert (1:47.625) would have also been enough for the top spot. Engel did not participate in the Roar as he was competing in the 24 Hours of Dubai.

Behind them follows a diverse field, with only Porsche and BMW lagging slightly behind.

Long-run consistency is far more critical. For our analysis, we considered all laps under 1:53 minutes to calculate the average. Every GTD Pro car completed more than 100 laps in this range, providing a solid database:

1. 75 Express Mercedes #75 ‚Äì 1:48.803 (130 laps)
2. Multimatic Ford #65 +0.213 (135 laps)
3. Multimatic Ford #64 +0.226 (124 laps)
4. Pratt Miller Corvette #3 +0.327 (121 laps)
5. Risi Ferrari #62 +0.355 (108 laps)
6. Vasser Sullivan Lexus #14 +0.382 (111 laps)
7. Pratt Miller Corvette #4 +0.386 (148 laps)
8. Pfaff Lamborghini #9 +0.408 (138 laps)
9. Triarsi Ferrari #033 +0.509 (143 laps)
10. GetSpeed Mercedes #69 +0.579 (137 laps)
11. Manthey Porsche #911 +0.636 (143 laps)
12. AO Porsche #77 +0.795 (121 laps)
13. RLL McLaren #59 +0.843 (145 laps)
14. Paul Miller BMW #1 +1.120 (111 laps)
15. Winward Mercedes #48 +1.167 (137 laps)

75 Express Racing maintains its lead, while Winward drops significantly. This is due to the driver line-up, which includes Bronze-rated Scott Noble and Silver driver Jason Hart, alongside two factory pros.

Ford appears to be the second-strongest force, slightly detached from the rest of the field.

The gap for Porsche and BMW is striking. In BMW‚Äôs case, it is particularly surprising as the M4 GT3 Evo is in its second year and fought for the podium last year with a less favourable BoP.

The RLL McLaren also loses ground. However, we must not forget that Nikita Johnson is Silver-rated, and both Juri Vips and Max Esterson are new to GT3 racing. Dean MacDonald serves as the benchmark for the trio.

To analyse "sprint qualities," we filtered the top 20% of all laps under 1:53 minutes. This reveals some interesting shifts:

1. 75 Express Mercedes #75 ‚Äì 1:47.890 min
2. Multimatic Ford #65 +0.275
3. Pfaff Lamborghini #9 +0.283
4. GetSpeed Mercedes #69 +0.283
5. Pratt Miller Corvette #3 +0.319
6. Winward Mercedes #48 +0.319
7. Pratt Miller Corvette #4 +0.391
8. Vasser Sullivan Lexus #14 +0.394
9. Risi Ferrari #62 +0.434
10. Multimatic Ford #64 +0.437
11. RLL McLaren #59 +0.480
12. Triarsi Ferrari #033 +0.507
13. Manthey Porsche #911 +0.556
14. AO Porsche #77 +0.820
15. Paul Miller BMW #1 +0.829

75 Express Racing dominates this category as well. Its lead is even larger here, thanks to an extraordinary number of laps in the 1:47s. While the "Solar Express" clocked 20 laps under 1:48 minutes, no other manufacturer came close ‚Äì the second-placed Ford #65 managed only five.

As expected, the other two Mercedes-AMG GT3s climb the rankings in this statistic, reflecting the influence of their factory drivers. From second place downwards, the field is separated by just over half a second, with Lamborghini making up some ground. Once again, Porsche and BMW find themselves at the bottom of the list.

Mercedes-AMG is showing extreme strength. However, since the three drivers for the #75 are not factory-contracted, they likely showed their full potential. Race week will reveal who has the most reserves left ‚Äì or if anyone receives a last-minute BoP adjustment.

Analysis: How the GTP manufacturers fared in the 'Roar before the 24'
